title: You can now run a GPT-3 level AI model on your laptop, phone, and Raspberry Pi
description: Thanks to Meta LLaMA, AI text models have their "Stable Diffusion moment."

title: Bees learn to dance and to solve puzzles from their peers
description: Two recent papers offer evidence of "social learning" and possible culture in bees.

title: Botnet that knows your name and quotes your email is back with new tricks
description: Quoting Herman Melville is only one of Emotet's latest innovations.

title: Report: Tim Cook overruled Apple design team’s request to delay XR headset
description: Article claims it’s about Cook’s legacy, but there may be more at play.

title: Florida surgeon general wrong on vaccines and bad at his job, CDC and FDA say
description: Ladapo has repeatedly peddled falsehoods about COVID-19 vaccines.

title: GM plans to let you talk to your car with ChatGPT, Knight Rider-style
description: It won't self-drive or fire missiles, but the AI might help you change a flat.

title: New data tracks failure rates of 13 SSD models, going back up to 4 years
description: Yearslong examination of thousands of boot drives provides unique perspective.

title: Floating solar panels could provide over a third of global electricity
description: Panels on reservoirs can keep enough water for 300 million people from evaporating.

title: Marvel angry about Ant-Man dialogue leak, demands names of Reddit and Google users
description: Reddit post linked to leak on Google Docs; Marvel tries to subpoena both firms.

title: Discord promises outraged users it won’t store call recordings—for now
description: Discord staff promises shocked Reddit users, "We are going to fix this."

title: Dealmaster: The latest desktop deals from HP, Dell, Acer, and more
description: Savings on productivity PCs, powerful gaming desktops, and everything in between.

title: Pixel Watch sales power Google to No. 2 in worldwide wearables marketshare
description: Canalys' marketshare charts show Google beating overall market decline.

title: Meta threatens to restrict news in Canada if it’s forced to pay publishers
description: Meta gave up this fight in Australia but is still battling US and Canada laws.

title: We need better crash test dummies, says Government Accountability Office
description: Current dummies don't give good data on women's risk of injuries, for example.

title: Why Sony says it can’t trust Microsoft’s Call of Duty offer? One word: Bethesda
description: Worries over "myriad ways Microsoft could circumvent its [cross-platform] obligations."

title: First Tesla, now Nissan: Another EV recall to replace a steering wheel
description: QC work at the port left some cars with incorrectly torqued steering wheel bolts.

title: Making sense of The Last of Us‘s thrilling, affecting season finale
description: Kyle & Andrew try to separate the heroes from the anti-heroes.
